results.title: Doc: a Portrait of Herbert Vere Evatt, 1894-1965
results.creator_credit: Pat Fiske, David McKnight, Denise Haslem, Film Australia and National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
results.brief_description: Known as “the Doc”, Evatt was an idealist, internationalist, a lawyer and a politician. He was the only Australian elected as President of the United Nations (1948) and the decisions he handed down as a High Court Judge had lasting effects on the course of Australian political history. Evatt fought to defeat an attempt to ban the Communist Party, only to find that his own party, the Australian Labor Party was deeply divided on the issue and his contentious role in 1950’s politics overshadows his many notable achievements. This excellent documentary blends commentary, newsreel footage and interviews with historians, family and public figures to offer a rare and moving insight into the life of one of Australia’s most notable political figures.

results.title: Large as life: an interview with Pat Thompson
results.creator_credit: Charlotte Seymour and Women's Program of the AFC
results.brief_description: Pat Thompson, one of Australia’s most dynamic and entertaining jazz singers, is interviewed about her life and the resumption of her career after an absence of 34 years.

results.title: Father
results.creator_credit: John Power, Damien Parer, Leftbank Productions and Barron Films
results.brief_description: Internationally renowned Max von Sydow heads a cast of acclaimed actors, including Carol Drinkwater, Julia Blake and Steve Jacobs, in this powerfully moving film. It tells the story of a family whose lives are shattered when their elderly father is accused of being a Nazi war criminal. Torn between family love and loyalty and the devastating realities of wartime Nazi Germany, all relationships are tested to the limit. Photography by Dan Burstall. AFI Awards were won by Max von Sydow and Julia Blake.

results.title: BabaKiueria
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Atherden, Don Featherstone, Julian Pringle and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
‘BabaKiueria’ takes a satirical look at black-white relations in late twentieth century Australia, with a comic depiction of a racial role reversal. In documentary (or ‘mockumentary’) style, the film’s presenter investigates white lives in the fictitious land of ‘BabaKiueria’ (‘Barbeque Area’), where white people are a minority, living under black laws and suffering from discriminatory practices and attitudes held by the black majority. Written by Geoffrey Atherden (‘Mother and Son’, ‘Grass Roots’), the film was awarded a United Nations Media Peace Prize in 1987.
Stars Michelle Torres, Bob Maza, Kevin Smith, Cecily Polson, Tony Barry.

results.title: Crocodile Dundee
results.creator_credit: Peter Faiman, John Cornell, Rimfire Films, Hoyts and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: A New York reporter is intrigued by stories of an Australian crocodile hunter, Mick ‘Crocodile’ Dundee, and accompanies him on a journey through the bush. She entices him back to Manhattan where his easy-going approach to the dangers of life in a big city make him a success in New York society. Stars Paul Hogan and Linda Kozlowski.

results.title: Two Laws
results.brief_description: An innovative film on the Borroloola people’s struggle for the recognition of Aboriginal law. Aborigines actively collaborated with the filmmakers in determining the form of the film which is in four parts. “Police times” is a dramatic re-enactment of white oppression in the 1930’s. “Welfare times” A re-enactment of life under the welfare system of the 1950’s. In “Struggle for our land” Aboriginal attachment to the land is described and the first hearing of the Borroloola land claim is also re-enacted. “Living with two laws” is concerned with the movement back to traditional land and the setting up of cattle out-stations.

results.title: Dot and Keeto
results.brief_description: Dot tumbles into a secret world when she shrinks to insect size in this enchanting tale. Dot and her new friend Keeto the Mosquito become involved in many adventures whilst searching for the secret bark that will return Dot to her normal size. Dot encounters many strange creatures during her searches, including the lovable Butterwalk the Caterpillar, Atlantis the Praying Mantis and the ruthless Queen Ant.

results.title: Antarctic Pioneers
results.creator_credit: Phillip Garth Law, Frank Hurley, Maslyn Williams, Frank Bagnall and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: One of Australia’s most famous photographers and explorers, Frank Hurley, presents this absorbing film on the history of Australia’s first expeditions to the Antarctic continent between 1911 and 1954. It includes remarkable, original footage of the expedition on the tall ship Aurora in 1911, the Campbell expedition in 1947 and the Law expedition in 1954. Much of this film was made by Hurley when he accompanied Sir Douglas Mawson and an Australian party to the Antarctic in 1912 and on later expeditions. The program traces the history of the Australian expeditions between 1911 and 1914 and the establishment of Mawson Station. A rare film which reveals the true hardship and courage of these early pioneers.

results.title: They're a weird mob
results.brief_description: ‘They’re a Weird Mob’ is about Sydney, Australia in 1965 - a sprawling, growing city of three million people - and what people! Easy going, down-to-earth and hilariously funny - a very weird mob. Into this city arrives innocent Italian migrant, Nino Culotta. The adventures of Nino fitting in with the ‘weird mob’, learning their ways and outlandish language are shown in this Australian comedy classic. The film was carefully marketed as an ‘Australian’ production, despite Powell’s presence as producer-director, his British director of photography, and a screenplay by his regular collaborator in England, Emeric Pressburger (using the pseudonym Richard Imrie). Based on the book by Nino Culotta (John O’Grady). Cast includes Walter Cohiari, Clare Dunne, Chips Rafferty, Ed Devereaux, John Meillion and Tony Bonner.

results.title: Mystery at castle house
results.creator_credit: Peter Maxwell, Brendon Lunney and Independent Productions (AU)
results.brief_description: Spider, an adventurous 12 year old, takes his new friends, Ben and Kate, across the harbour to a deserted old mansion, Castle House. Two other boys disappear before their eyes in the overgrown grounds, the eccentric elderly owner suddenly returns, and Spider and his friends find a secret tunnel. Filmed around the natural bushland and bays of Sydney Harbour, it’s action all the way with enough crazy fun to keep children and their parents spellbound.
